title: Lost all app data after clicking free coins and monstera promo, customer service unresponsive
content: I have been using the app since 2019 and I have enjoyed doing the monthly challenges this year. Recently, however, when I clicked on the free coins and monstera promo on June 5th, my app reset, wiping out all the rewards I‚Äôd earned since 2019. I have reached out to customer service for assistance but have not heard back. I don‚Äôt anticipate they will respond or help me fix it so I am now looking for a different app to use to help me focus. Thanks for nothing, Pomodoro Timer.

title: Nice app
content: My friendly AI app recommended this Forest to me. üåüApparently, I downloaded it and never opened it prior to the recommendation. Still, in the context of why it was recommended to focus on intentionally settling down throughout the day, it has been a compliment to my life.

title: Adult Female with ADD
content: I love this app, it‚Äôs so helpful by blocking out applications that are not in the preselected list(that you can customize). Which helps prevent doom scrolling and distractions that are on your device, if you choose to use an app that is not on the list will result in the death of your tree. I know it‚Äôs not a real tree but it does help with the negative reinforcement feeling that I need to stay focused. I‚Äôm in college also so need help blocking off my study times. I do also still use an pomodoro timer bc I need an added visual aid, but using both together has been a game changer in my everyday life. Would totally recommend this app to a friend.

title: Great
content: You can set it by minutes to 2 hours so it really helps with focusing for that moment, and seeing the trees grow, it‚Äôs like a reward for your discipline.

title: Thanks!!!
content:
I‚Äôve tried several apps to help me stay focused while studying, but Forest is the only one that truly transformed how I learn. As someone who used to struggle with attention and often felt frustrated for not ‚Äúgiving my all,‚Äù Forest helped me turn my perfectionism into a healthy motivation.

The ability to ‚Äúplant trees‚Äù that grow based on how long I stay focused pushes me to beat my own record every day, and that has boosted my productivity like nothing else. Now I can maintain long study sessions (7 to 8 hours or more in a day) with steady focus that used to feel impossible.

Plus, seeing my progress visually reflected in a growing forest gives me a real, tangible sense of achievement. Forest has helped me not only study faster but also process and digest information better, moving past the anxiety of immediate perfection to focus on steady progress.

For anyone struggling with concentration or motivation, Forest isn‚Äôt just an app‚Äîit‚Äôs a companion that helps you reprogram your mind and build habits that actually work.

Suggestions: I would love to see a widget for iPhone standby mode to make tracking even easier. Also, giving users more opportunities to earn or buy trees would be awesome‚Äîbecause who wouldn‚Äôt want a bigger, greener forest?

title: Dislike the ‚ÄúPay-to-Play‚Äù
content: The concept behind these focus apps is to hijack our brain‚Äôs reward systems to be productive rather than distracting. You get dopamine from focusing and getting a tree planted. But when the ‚Äúreward‚Äù (planting a tree, unlocking trees, etc) becomes the goal in itself, then the app becomes a distraction in itself.  The first time I stopped using this app, I stopped because I had become obsessed with growing a beautiful forest. I notice there‚Äôs a lot of ‚Äúpay-to-play‚Äù that takes advantage of this misdirected reward system, where you can pay to get more coins or diamonds to get more rewards. It would be good if these options were not so visible on the app and could be turned off and only accessible in the settings. This takes advantage of our brain‚Äôs reward systems for the developers‚Äô profit rather than helping us direct it towards becoming productive.

title: Honestly kind of boring
content: It's hard to stay focused with something like this even: if anything it just makes me more stressed about goals, since its about numbers rather than successes.

title: ASAP
content: This is the only thing that is keeping my Adhd in check . But what happens after I buy all of the trees from store ‚Ä¶!? I don‚Äôt want to lose motivation‚Ä¶. Can you add more trees .. or add more feature likes your tree grows this much in a month of grass grows this much ‚Ä¶or features like being able to buy a lawn mover or pesticide for trees or ornaments for trees‚Ä¶. Something to keep the forest customized according to the user‚Ä¶ anyone with adhd or autism will love these ‚Ä¶. I have a very detailed UI and plan for 20 + features that are simple enough to use and will keep up the momentum if you are interested:)

title: Event takes my coins or doesn‚Äôt work at all.
content: This event was supposed to be fun! I really wanted the 11th anniversary cake. And now I think honestly the glitches scammed me out of it. I can‚Äôt spend coins because if I do the event takes them and doesn‚Äôt give a reward. Now when I go to the event it forever loads and does not tell me how many wishes I have left, or how many more. I have to be guaranteed the cake tree. This is so upsetting, I miss when the goal was to focus long enough to unlock the cake.

title: I regret buying this app
content:
This is not an app that is trying to support users to focus. It‚Äôs a store that‚Äôs optimized to make money and that‚Äôs all. It has a million ways to add to distraction instead of lessen them. It‚Äôs constantly trying to see you things. It tries to encourage longer focus times without breaks, even though studies show that‚Äôs both cognitively and physically (if you‚Äôre sitting) unhelpful - meaning the makers of this app fundamentally don‚Äôt understand the pomodoro method.

Even worst, it doesn‚Äôt actually block other apps like it says it does.  In order try to make that work you have to do an enormous additional amount of work in settings to change how screen time works. It‚Äôs also super buggy and crashes

title: Work for me
content: Forest is an amazing productivity app. Simple, effective, and it genuinely helped me stay focused and build better habits.

title: It does do breaks
content: It‚Äôs not intuitive, but after a focus session you can manually start a break timer. So it does do Pomodoro but it‚Äôs not as obvious about it as it should be.

title: helpful app, but a bad bug.
content:
typically i‚Äôm skeptical with paying for apps since i don‚Äôt know if i will like what i payed for, but i‚Äôve been using it for half a year since i have terrible adhd, so i think i‚Äôm good in that regard. however, with the most recent update ( i‚Äôve seen others mention the same issue ), all of my planted trees‚Äîexcept yesterdays‚Äîhave disappeared completely? 

i use this app to document hours for driving, and some other activities too. typically, i document my driving hours at the end of every week ( though i‚Äôm behind on my documentation because i have been really busy ). today, i just so happened to check how many hours i had done this week and a couple previous times so i could write it down, when poof! ‚Ä¶suddenly, i have no trees in my forest from this week, last month, and even from when i started last year. this is quite stressful and upsetting for me, as i am working towards getting my license. now i‚Äôm missing hours in my record that i should have had so that i can progress. i would really appreciate if this gets fixed asap.

title: Life changing
content: This app has seriously improved my life.  It has trained me to not look to my phone as a distraction and instead forces me to think about It first and then refocus my energy and most times that means making a more positive choice than doomscrolling

title: Amazing help with online classes
content: This app is absolutely amazing. As a person who easily gets distracted by their phone in online classes I can easily set a timer with a tag for school on deep focus mode and it helps me not get distracted. It also is very satisfying when you have a forest filled with almost no dead trees. Definitely would recommend to a friend

title: great
content: I love this app! There is a lot of cute trees and I can focus more with this! üíóüíóüíóüíó

title: Helps my ADHD
content: A great tool for helping people with ADHD. Reminds me to focus on one task, helps me to remember to take breaks, is kinda cute too. One of my favorite apps.

title: Silence the noise
content: This app helps me refrain from mindlessly reopening and/or refreshing apps. Refocuses your energy off the doom scroll machine.

title: Awesome
content:
That‚Äôs really awesome and useful,
I used some time management apps before, but this app helped me stay more focused and I won‚Äôt even realize how I have done my work!

title: Phenomenal App
content: This app is genuinely wonderful in every sense of the word. No ads, ability to change which apps are allowed in deep focus, different tags for focusing, many different trees to choose from, and even the option to plant real trees using your earned coins! I also love the statistics you can see after studying for a while. I have logged 45 hours so far and I can‚Äôt wait to keep going! Phenomenal app overall.

title: Helped a lot
content: This app has been so helpful and fun especially because I have adhd it has really let me focus

title: Came back to the app after a hiatus
content: I used this app when I studied for the MCAT. I came back after a few years to help with mindfulness and found this app really helps keep me focused. Thanks Forest ü•∞

title: Deleted YEARS of Data
content:
After years of happily using this product to help me focus, I opened the app to find that ALL of my user data, purchased add-ons, and records are gone. I didn‚Äôt change phones, delete/reinstall the app, or do anything to prompt this deletion. I didn‚Äôt even know I had been operating in guest mode until I had the login prompt: continuing as a guest didn‚Äôt make a difference, all of my usage data and purchases were already gone. And no, I didn‚Äôt switch between the ‚ÄúChina server‚Äù and the ‚Äúglobal server.‚Äù

I will now be looking for a new focus app; I am so disappointed after paying for this app and being a product evangelist for almost a decade. Don‚Äôt trust them with your data if they‚Äôll lose it for no reason.

title: Too many bugs, not enough updates
content: I love this app but there are too many bugs. The widgets never work and no matter how I set the focus it doesn‚Äôt make apps I have in the focus unavailable. I want to love this but it‚Äôs just not worth it. I‚Äôll be finding a different focus app.

title: Constant bugs lately
content: I have been using this app for many years now and I have recommended it to so many people. But for the past several months, there are constant bugs that cause me to spend more time messing with the app and I can‚Äôt just ‚Äúset it and forget it‚Äù like I used to. The bugs are mostly relegated to the newer Focus Challenges, which I thought would be really helpful for me earlier in the day when I want to get smaller tasks done. Now I can‚Äôt click on the screen to accept the reward from completing a challenge right away, I have to let it sit here for nearly a minute before I can finally click on it. When the feature first came out I would get an error any time I tried to complete a challenge. Then when that was finally fixed, it wasn‚Äôt giving me credit for a while until 12+ hours later. I paid for the full version of this app long ago and I am really disappointed lately. I need something to help me with productivity, not frustrate me and cause more of a distraction. If a feature doesn‚Äôt work properly, don‚Äôt release it until it is ready. ‚ÄúBeta‚Äù or not. That isn‚Äôt right, especially for your paying customers.

title: Cute!
content: So cute and fun makes me want to focus

title: Focus
content: Worth every penny fr! Very Good app for monk mode, or just focus in general. Also as you build up your forest you can start to plant real trees so then your focus becomes an act of giving back to nature in every moment. I hope you guys spend the couple dollars and become a human again and enjoy your time with friends and family in the process üíØüå≤

title: Highly recommend
content: Great app for focusing, app works well almost all the time. Developer is responsive to issues with the app, on the rare occasions they occur.

title: Always a motivator
content: I‚Äôm so much more productive with this app. It helps me focus and the flexibility to choose. The amount of time is so helpful.

title: Perfect
content: It really helps me to focus on my studies!

title: I really appreciate this app üòÅ
content: This is such a useful tool to stay focused and track my focus work!  So many extra features that aren‚Äôt needed but are really helpful!

title: Great app!
content:
Forest has been great so far! I‚Äôve literally completed hours worth of cleaning this week. I love the little trees and being able to plant with my friend. I also love the count up timer as I hate normal timer focus options that force me to break focus but this is great!

I have some issues with the allow list (customizable lists of apps you‚Äôre allowed to use while focusing). The main thing is my app freezes whenever I try to add anything from the education section or search for particular apps. That‚Äôs my only sincere problem with the app though. 

The following are just some possible suggestions I‚Äôve thought of:
I would appreciate the ability to change allow lists and/or task tags partway through a session. 
A pause/break option (with allow list still functioning) because sometimes things do come up or maybe you get tired
Honestly that‚Äôs it. I really like this app so far though

title: Keeps messing up tags
content:
I have multiple tags for the things I focus on, which is helpful for the charts and graphs it provides, but it keeps deleting or changing the names of them. Nearly every time I go to start a timer with a tag, half of my tags are renamed to have a 1 or 2 at the end of it. I‚Äôd have a ‚ÄúStudy‚Äù timer but when I look at it I‚Äôll have a ‚ÄúStudy 1‚Äù ‚ÄúStudy 1 1‚Äù and a ‚ÄúStudy 1 1 1‚Äù timer, or even worse the study timer would just be deleted. 

Please fix this bug as it makes it feel pointless to track what I‚Äôm doing if you‚Äôre going to keep deleting, adding, or renaming my tags

title: Best one time purchase of my life
content: Been using since 2018. Life changing for those with adhd. It helped me get into NYU and graduate with honors in high school. Can't recommend it highly enough. I'm devastated that they switched to a subscription model. I Guess the investors got really greedy.

title: So far so good
content: I‚Äôm enjoying being able to ‚Äúgrow‚Äù pretty plants. This is helping me somewhat with my ADHD to keep on track for longer than I have been able to focus in the past. I‚Äôm still learning the app and settings but so far I‚Äôm happy.

title: So many bugs
content: Almost every time I go to the ‚ÄúFocus Challenges‚Äù there are so many bugs. Sometimes I finish the challenges and it won‚Äôt let me get the award. Now challenges are not even visible and says ‚Äú1,975‚Äù yrs, 9 mths‚Äù. I have been using this app for so many years and it seems that these bugs are getting out of control now. So sad. It was a good app, I‚Äôm considering to delete it.

title: Buggy but nice concept
content: The function of growing trees while studying/focusing works and is nice, but there are frequent bugs afflicting the focus challenges.

title: Fix bugs!
content: Focus challenge page crashed and did not log my accomplishments of challenge!!

title: Guaranteed frustration
content: The focus challenge was designed by a psychologist to cause distress. You see tasks that you can complete for a reward. You complete the task. Reward status does not update. It's like when you work out for three hours and your apple watch fails to update your rings. I spent way too much time trying to refresh the app to get credit for these challenge tasks. It's embarrassing. I just have to delete forest and get on with my life. Seemed fun but it is actual psychological torture.

title: Finally an app that can keep my reading streaks or anything I do!
content: I found the app on chatgpt. I was looking for ways to increase my reading and make it more entertaining and maybe impossible to forget. An app that gives you that craving to go and read! This app helped me and the ideas of planting trees while you‚Äôre doing something and focusing is just so cute! Thank you guys!

title: Great for work focus w/ADHD
content: I started using Forest as a last resort during a difficult period in my life, where balancing life and focus was becoming overwhelmingly impossible. It‚Äôs option to lock all other apps while on the focus timer has been a game changer! It helps me focus for multiple hours on my work without going back to my phone, and the locked apps keep me from derailing my focus process!

title: I love it
content: I‚Äôm in STEM and have ADHD so this helps

title: Great productivity app sometimes glitchy
content:
Love the trees and events, focus challenge is a great addition, BUT it glitches and sometimes doesn‚Äôt complete the challenge when I planted what I needed to: doesn‚Äôt let me collect gifts. 
Also, the allow list is glitchy I can only add apps one at a time or it crashes within 5-10 seconds and kicks me out of ‚Äúedit allow list tab‚Äù

title: Awesome
content: This app helps me focus so well

user_name: C h a n e l l e
title: Life Saver
content: Coming from someone who struggles with a low attention span, gonna keep this review short as possible. This is a life changer, no other words, it helps me focus on getting stuff done. If ur thinking about whether or not to get it, do itüôèüèΩ

title: Major technical issues
content:
I REALLY love this app, but when it comes to functionality, I find myself not able to rely on the whitelist and Deep Focus function that is supposed to lock and unlock certain apps. I‚Äôve had a bug for months where every time I try to edit my whitelists or create new ones, the screen goes blank and I have to close and reopen the app. So, I can only enable my Deep Focus when I want my iPhone completely bricked, which is very rare because I don‚Äôt like that it bricks my iMessage in the default settings. Really wish they could fix this. I‚Äôve reached out to customer service about the inability to use safari, when when it‚Äôs included in a whitelist, and they informed me there‚Äôs nothing to do about that. 
But aside from technicality, I love this app, which is why I wish it ran smoother

title: So much potential
content: I usually never write app reviews but I really wanted to give my feedback on this one! I love this app but it would be so much more fun and fulfilling to use if it had a feature that allowed you to visualize the focus time you give to certain categories. For me, I use a specific type of tree for each project im working on,etc. so that when I look at my garden I can kind of visualize where my energy is going. It would be amazing if the app incorporated one of those matching puzzle type of game elements to grow a larger tree by combining trees of a certain type. I think it would be really fun to be able to earn 3 small trees then combine those into a bigger tree, then earn 3 of those and make an even bigger tree, you get the idea. It would be more visually appealing to see the trees with more drastic size differences too. Also i think there‚Äôs a nice metaphorical reminder in there that the plant you water most will grow the tallest. Please consider adding these features !

title: best app
content: I never leave app reviews but I have been using Forest regularly (daily) for the past 3 years and it is wonderful. I love how new tree species are added, the focus challenge is my absolute favorite and really motivates me to turn my phone off more. I would recommend this app to anyone with ADHD that is trying to get through their education, Forest helps me so much. To the developers: continue the Focus challenge, game-ifying being off your phone helps ADHD folks so much.

title: Awesome Study tool!
content: I needed an app to help me stay focus and productive when trying to complete a task. This app is amazing for achieving those goals. Personally I wish the times were longer but longer isn‚Äôt always good/necessary.

title: The only one-time purchase you‚Äôll never regret
content: I love this app. Been using it for two years now and I can honestly say, it is one of the best apps for productivity. The thought of you cancelling your focus session and seeing dead trees in your forest, makes you control your urges and focus back onto your task. I‚Äôm not sure about the new subscription model but for now the lifetime purchase has been a game changer for me. Would 100% recommend it to everyone.

title: Life Changing
content: Listen. I have a lot going on. I am about to turn 30, mid-divorce, and beginning a new chapter of life as a single mom. I cannot oversell it: this app is getting me through it. Stuck in ADHD freeze mode and depressed? Not anymore. My lil focus forest is growing and I am accomplishing more than I thought I could. I love it.

title: Completely deleted all my previous data.
content:
I‚Äôve had this app for years and I used it religiously! It has helped me deal with my ADHD so much and it made me so proud when I could get a new plant and see all my progress.
That is until one day I opened the app and I was logged out of my account. That had never happened, I was confused but though it probably just updated or something. But when I logged back in, it was like I had just purchased the app. There was no record of previous years and I only had the plants you start with. I went to the settings and followed the instructions to try to recover data, which didn‚Äôt work. So I emailed the support email and haven‚Äôt received anything back from them. 
I am very disappointed by this because this app has actually improved my productivity tremendously and I really hope this can be fixed.

title: It is a great app but it needs more challenges
content: We need at least two focus  monthly  challenges to keep the users engage and motivate them to use the app daily to be more productive in their daily lives.

title: Pursuing a graduate degree with this app‚Ä¶
content: I never leave comments but I‚Äôm so extremely grateful for this app, I just have to share. I have ADHD-like tendencies (not diagnosed), and pursuing a graduate degree seemed like a big jump. Thanks to this app, the amount of time that I can focus increased from 15 minutes at a time to one hour! I added a widget to my Home Screen that shows my forest everyday, as well as how many minutes I‚Äôve studied. It‚Äôs a huge motivation to sit down and focus for even just a short time everyday to see some trees on the Home Screen page. I feel proud at the end of the day/week/month looking back at my lush forest. Also, thank you also for adding the challenges! I usually finish them pretty quickly but they help me to start my month off right, and I can ride the momentum even after I‚Äôve completed the challenge. I use the app in conjunction with the finch app, and also study with me videos on YouTube. :)

title: Anti-Doomscroll Medication
content: Forest helps me avoid doomscrolling and stay focused on important tasks. What makes this app particularly effective is that my subconscious doesn‚Äôt want to kill the tree. Unlike other apps, where I can exit without consequence, Forest makes me less tempted to get distracted. Instead of subconsciously looking for an escape, my mind stays focused on my work.

title: Can‚Äôt edit allowed app list
content: I want to add somes apps to a new allowed app list for deep focus mode, but the app freezes everytime the app list shows up

title: Organized
content: So far I‚Äôm loving it. I feel rewarded for keeping track of time. This is perfect for time blocking and setting a frame to focus.

title: Helpful for mindfulness
content: This app is so much fun and helps me stay focused on what needs to be done, with gentle reminders and a cute forest to look forward to planting üòä

title: Helpful with ADHD and doomscrolling.
content: I have really severe ADHD and have a heavy workload. I‚Äôve gotten more done in the last few days with Forest than I probably did all of last week. It can be hard to find stuff that helps but this app really, REALLY helps for me!!

title: Helpful in so many ways other than productivity
content:
I have ADHD, and while medication helps me focus, I still struggle with too little focus or too much focus. (iykyk)

Gamifying my focus cycle has helped balance the scales and break some bad habits, including mindlessly scrolling on my phone for a dopamine hit when I should be doing a work task)
So, yes, it helps me stay focused, it also helps me to remember to take breaks periodically and to not dilly-dally to much during them.

title: Fantastic Focus App
content: This is so much better than Opal, which is always trying to sell you a subscription. This has a clean, calming interface, can block your apps, and the tree planting is  an awesome way to track your focusing progress. Really recommend this one.

title: I love it!
content: Fun way to keep tract on focusing on Studying my Bible and study for my meetings.

title: Locked in
content: Actually has helped me focus

title: Most effective productivity tool I‚Äôve tried
content: This is such a simple concept but it has really helped my ADHD brain start focused. I particularly like the focus challenges. I use it when I‚Äôm writing my novel, which is most of the day. Definitely worth giving it a try!

title: Productivity gamified
content: I‚Äôve been using this app since 2018 but found myself using it more than ever since they added the Focus Challenge that lets you unlock coins/crystals for completing specific tasks. This has been a game changer for me, and I feel more motivated to unlock the other trees and shrubs.  Sometimes I do wish there were other ways to sort through trees, like by type or alphabetical, however it‚Äôs manageable as is.

title: Super cute game, worth the $4!
content: I love this, it‚Äôs simple and cute and aside from paying for the app, you do not have to pay to use it! There is only one way to get more trees, and that‚Äôs by getting coins. There is only one way to get coins, and that‚Äôs by focusing and finishing challenges (and you have the option of tripling your earnings for $1 for a whole week)!!! No cheats, no shortcuts, all focus. Helps me stay off my phone and focus more on my hobbies :‚Ä¢)

title: Fun app for adhd
content: It‚Äôs good motivating app to help me focus and feel better after being productive! Strongly recommend.

title: Love it
content: Although there are bugs, the app has been wonderful! It keeps me focused and motivated

title: Cute idea but doesn‚Äôt work
content: I liked the idea of this app. The design is attracted and it seems like it‚Äôd be very motivating. The problem? It doesn‚Äôt block out apps. At all. I could clock right past the growing trees to do whatever I wanted on my phone and it just kept on counting time toward my ‚Äúfocus streak.‚Äù I did all the troubleshooting steps on their website and same thing happened. I reached out to the manufacturers via the only means I could find - a website chat - and never got a response. Requested a refund today. Back to the drawing board.

title: Don‚Äôt update to new version
content:
Bugs are still there.
I updated to the new version, now focus challenge doesn‚Äôt load completely!

title: Great app for focusing
content: Great app and has been helping me focus. I only wish there was more options for personalization.

title: App has become unstable recently
content: I love forest and I use it all the time. However, for the past month, the app has become unusable. When a focus ends, it takes multiple tries to get out of focus mode. The app crashes all the time when I attempt to open it. Please fix it!

title: Upset with new changes
content:
I‚Äôve been a long time user of the app forest for around 4 years now when I bought the app. I feel as if the core of the app really does improve focus through creating good habits. However when I was made aware of the paid subscription update as well as the addition of AI I was very upset. I believe there are 4 big problems with these changes. 1). AI is bad for the environment and and for an app that prides itself on its environmental impacts it seems like implementing ai is just a way to be ‚Äútrendy‚Äù and doesn‚Äôt follow the apps core values. On the website forest states ‚ÄúAt Forest, we believe that better selves build a better world.‚Äù Building a better world does not include implementing AI when it is unnecessary and unhelpful. 2). Forest is a very simple app that works to break your phone addiction so adding all these bits and bobs are not helpful/useful and most of the time annoying. 3). Forest is already very buggy. For being around for years I feel as if there are big bugs that should be worked on instead of rolling out new features that no one asked for or wanted. 4). My final complaint is that I already spent the money to buy the app and asking its users to now pay for a subscription model is just another money grab. If I am asked to buy the subscription I will be switching to another app. 
Once again forest used to be my favorite focus app but now seeing the changes coming I fear I may need to choose another option that values its users.

title: So fun very helpful
content: Such an entertaining way to track your focus on certain projects!

title: I love it üòç
content: It is really helpful and cute when you need to focus. Don‚Äôt wanna kill the garden. üòã

title: Great (except for some bugs)
content: I think the app is a great way to stay focused on tasks and not be tempted to pick up the phone and scroll through social media (which is a big problem for me). I also like the stats that they gather for each week and month. A great way to see how productive I have been in a day, which has been rewarding. Definitely worth the initial cost. My only criticism is the bugs that are in the app. There are times when the app just freezes on me. I will click on the plant button and nothing will happen but when I refresh and reopen the app, it shows as though the trees died even though I didn‚Äôt do anything. When I go to edit my app restrictions list, sometimes it will just pull up a blank white screen. This has been an issue that has persisted for a while now. I have restarted my phone and everything. Now I‚Äôm just using coins to get rid of the mistaken dead trees but it‚Äôs gotten more annoying especially now that I‚Äôm using the app more frequently.

title: Please make an account!!
content: I love this app. I have been using it for the past several months to help me focus at work, after learning about it and using it a little bit in college. I had so many tree types, and had even planted a real one. I had data from all of those months, and had started to use tree types to try and show the weather of the day/ the time of year. The app gets a bit glitchy, and sometimes won‚Äôt open. It was after one of these times that even when I was able to get the app to open, it wouldn‚Äôt go anywhere. I decided it was best to delete the app and reinstall to see if that would help. It has, but the down side was that I had not created an account. I didn‚Äôt know that that was something I had to do. I lost everything. Every tree I gained. Every achievement. I had gained trees from special events that I don‚Äôt know if I will ever be able to get again. All of them, all my data. Gone. So please, learn from me, make an account. Don‚Äôt go through the pain of starting completely over like I am going to do now. At least it‚Äôs at the start of a new year I guess.

title: Great Motivator!
content: This has been an excellent rewarding app for keeping focused on what I need to do in order to achieve my goals! Reason for docking a star: I am disappointed to hear that soon there will be a subscription requirement‚Ä¶ I guess that‚Äôs what most apps have to do these days in order to keep making money, but it‚Äôs just another subscription I would have to keep up with and not sure it will be worth it‚Ä¶ If subscription is required, could there be a lifetime pay-once option? Or get grandfathered in, considering I had to pay to get the app to begin with? :(

title: Productivity
content: Love this app. Really helps me stay focused.

title: Love it!
content: I‚Äôve been using this app for years and it‚Äôs amazing. Huge thanks for recent update with lofi music for focus, so many great options. I love feature of planting real trees!!! Comfortable tags, different trees, everything you could wish for in app like that. 100/100

title: love forest
content: i LOVE using forest. i‚Äôve used it on and off for years now (just new phones etc) and it‚Äôs my go to for focus timers

title: Stay on Target!
content: In the original Star Wars, During the first run on the death star pilot of the fighter kept getting distracted. The squadron leader kept telling him ‚ÄúStay on target.‚Äù ‚ÄúStay on target.‚Äù As I have used for us for the last few days I keep hearing that squadron commander‚Äôs voice in my ear every time I‚Äôm tempted to shift my focus. Thank you FOREST!

title: It would be 5 stars but‚Ä¶
content: There are a few glitches that need to be worked out. For one, I wish there was a way I could get more than double coins back, like triple or quadruple the coins. It also kicks me out of the app for seemingly no reason (only sometimes though). Now the clock won‚Äôt display on my phones Home Screen at all, and I don‚Äôt remember disabling it, so I presume that it‚Äôs a glitch. Also, and I‚Äôm pretty sure this is by design, but if you delete the memory of the app (swiping up and swiping up again), it will stop the deep focus and stop the the time on the homescreen, but I don‚Äôt think it stops the time in the app this means that I would have to wait whatever time is left to reset the time. I don‚Äôt know why these are happening, and any help would be greatly appreciated.

title: Love this
content: This app helps me to stay off my phone and stay focused

title: Calming Focus
content: I have had this app on my android and now my iPhone for three years. It is to date the only app I‚Äôve ever spent money on, and I still consider money well spent. The aesthetic, calming and motivating app design have helped me focus more than any other.

title: Perhaps it‚Äôs the New Year‚Ä¶
content:
I love this app. It has allowed me to focus for almost 600 hrs this year. However the last few times I‚Äôve opened the app, it seems to shut down and also not working as fast. I‚Äôd contact them through the app, but it shuts down before I can even get to my settings.
I‚Äôm hoping for a bug fix update soon.

title: Good but needs update
content:
Pros: Good for focus and gamification. 
Con: not compatible with shortcuts for automation. 
No communication from support. No 12hr clock.

title: Thank you!
content:
I find myself going to my phone too much, and whereas Apple‚Äôs screen time controls are essentially useless (allowing indefinite 15min extensions), this app actually blocks them effectively for me and incentivizes me with adorable trees when I have just enough willpower to plant a tree but not enough to keep myself from continually trying to go to Facebook out of habit. My focus, productivity, and bedtime has been much improved.  ^_^

There have been a couple little bugs at times for me where the app doesn‚Äôt load or refresh properly, but the fact that most of the time it has kept me off my phone are well worth it, and I‚Äôm sure the team is constantly improving the app. 

Also, I was elated that I could get this with a one-time purchase instead of a subscription. Those are nightmares. üí∏

title: Life changing
content: I love this app so much. I used to fixate on reducing my screentime but now I‚Äôm fixated on making the most out of my day and focusing on the things that matter. It‚Äôs truly life altering to operate this way and the app is beautiful, clever, thoughtful and I‚Äôm saving up for get real trees next.

title: Best App
content: This is the best app to stay focused with!! Love it :)

title: used to love it
content: really buggy‚Ä¶ focus challenge won‚Äôt load, and i can‚Äôt stay signed in. every time i try to open the app it prompts me to sign in and then shows an error code. i can‚Äôt start or stop any timers and now im worried that i will lose all of my trees. disappointed with the updates and the lack of fixing these issues. the sign-in issue just started with the new update‚Ä¶ do NOT update yet!

title: Used to be great
content: I used this app for years but now none of the new features load and their ‚ÄòSeekr‚Äô won‚Äôt let me join/log in. Just another example of an app going down the tubes for new features. Uninstalling. I just want to be able to open an app and track focus.

title: Horrible
content: This app the current focus challenge never loads no one from support ever contacts you and they never fix anything. I‚Äôm finding a new app to use.

title: The most Productivity app
content:
I used to have a hard time focusing on what‚Äôs on my hands, like studying and practicing the piano. With the help of the Forest team, I‚Äôve form the habit of concentrating on what‚Äôs going on. The cute trees design and interfaces also indicate the hard work the team had done. Whenever I clip into my forest, I have a sense of accomplishment and want to plant even more. 
Thank you Forest!

title: Best Productivity App
content: I‚Äôve been using this since 2019. it‚Äôs the best app to use to be productive while still having fun while you work. Best focus app out there by far.

title: Not blocking apps
content: I just paid $4 to download this and it‚Äôs not blocking me from using other apps at all. I have it in deep focus mode, enabled it to track other apps, ensured my other apps aren‚Äôt set to always allow on my phone, but still nothing happens, rendering this app entirely useless, since that‚Äôs the only point of it. In fact, the only app I can‚Äôt use while in deep focus mode is the Forest app!!

title: Awesome pomodoro alternative
content: This app is absolutely awesome and I like it at. I utilize my focus and get rewarded that I‚Äôm doing something good such as planting a tree.

title: An OK pomodoro app with poor Apple Watch support
content:
Update 12/2024: the app has become very unstable, with extremely long loading times, frequent crashes, and the inability to start sessions. 

Some frustrating bugs remain unfixed. One is example is that if you start a session with deep focus enabled, and immediately cancel it, your apps will still be blocked.

Would be nice after a year of planting trees to be able to zoom in on the forest instead of viewing at an extreme distance.

The most frustrating aspect of Forest is the limited Apple Watch support. If users could start focus sessions without using their phones, they would look at their phones less. Which is the whole point of using the app. But that feature isn‚Äôt available. Instead, all you can do is look at your forest.

Other annoyances are some questionable UI choices, like the annoying pop up on the view Forest screen that can‚Äôt be turned off. 

Balanced against this is the clever tree planting system which gives users a stake in completing through on their focus sessions. Also valuable are the statistics, competitions, and ability to acquire more flora through sweat equity. These features make Forest one of the best pomodor apps. It‚Äôs just unfortunate to miss on something as basic and useful as Apple Watch support.

title: Bugs with newly released features
content:
This is a great app, but the focus challenge is extremely broken even for Beta release. There are also some issues with the ‚Äúplanting tree together‚Äù function. I am hoping a fix gets rolled out soon to address all the glitches

If you are using the app for just base purposes (planting trees solo and focusing) it works well

title: Love the Focus Challenge! Keep it!
content:
I‚Äôm not sure I‚Äôve written a review for an app but I feel passionately enough to write this. 
First I‚Äôve been a forest user for 7 years now. I‚Äôve only really started relying on it in the past 2 years but I‚Äôve always enjoyed how the app functions. The UI is easy to navigate, it‚Äôs easy to designate apps that won‚Äôt be turned off. Getting coins for each focus session to unlock new trees is always a treat. And it‚Äôs really fun to do longer sessions to grow bigger trees/plants! 

But I think that this focus challenge mode will be a game changer for me. It‚Äôs enticing me to want to use the app every single day even when I may not need to focus. I love that it gives you crystals if you do a particularly hard challenge, which are otherwise locked behind a paywall. And I love that the daily challenges change and are building toward a reward at the end of the month! What a GREAT ADDITION! 
Please, keep it! DON‚ÄôT change ANYTHING, particularly the crystals cause that‚Äôs just corporate scumminess. We‚Äôre only getting five and I‚Äôm SO OKAY with that. 
But in general, keep the challenges, it inspires attention to what you‚Äôre planting and can entice the user to get new trees. GREAT ADDITION again, continue doing great things!

title: College Student Approved
content: Helps me focus so well! I absolutely love it and the trees are so cute!

title: Love
content: I focus better on

title: Really helpful so far!
content: I love trees and so far this has been a great way to keep me focused at work.

title: Best Productivity App
content: I started using this app in high school and I am now in law school. It truly helps keep you focused. I am motivated by not killing my tree and to continue planting so I can get coins to buy more trees. I love how you can plant real trees. I really like the focus challenge they are currently doing; I like having a different way to get a new species and it provides an outside motivation to get your work done. I love how in December it turns to a winter theme, but you do have the option to turn that off. I like being able to choose between stopwatch and timer because sometimes I don‚Äôt know how long I want to work for but I don‚Äôt want to kill my tree if I need to work for less than I set the timer for. I also think it is great you can customize your allow list. I also love being able to look at your forest as days, weeks, months, or years. It is interesting going back to see what I was focusing on, what months I focus the most, and even what years I was most focused. I have never had a problem with this app! I think it would be cool if different seasons and holidays get decorations like December does. For example, spider webs and bats for October or sparkles and hearts for Valentine‚Äôs Day. I also would love more species to buy or win through future focus challenges. I wonder if you could add a pomodoro timer to the app so you can have scheduled breaks.

title: Extremely Motivating
content:
Forest is exactly what I was looking for. It keeps me on target and eliminates my phone as a distraction. It‚Äôs motivating to want to keep the little trees and plants alive, and it‚Äôs always fun to change to a different type of plant or flower. 

The best part (and most motivating thing to me) is working to plant a real tree. Knowing that my focus time can actually be spent on something that makes the real world better really encourages me to keep pushing. 

I would recommend Forest to anyone and everyone.

title: Great App
content: Help you focus! I love it

title: Awesome but be careful
content: For some reason the app stopped blocking other apps during focus time recently, defeating its purpose. After reinstalling, all my unlocked trees and records of countless hours of focus were gone. Have to start all over again..

title: Great tool for ADHD management. Almost perfect!
content: I love Forest‚Äôs easy to navigate interface and the variety of tree species there are to grow. It‚Äôs my favorite Pomodoro app. The one (kind of big) criticism I have is that there is no way to select which variation of a tree species you grow. It‚Äôs better for me to set my day into smaller chunks of focus time, but that means I never get to see the other variations of trees available when setting the timer to 60‚Äì120+ minutes. It‚Äôs really disappointing; it takes kind of a long time to save enough coins for them, only to never/rarely get to grow anything past the ‚Äúyoung‚Äù, less robust tree.

title: Helpful app.
content: Great for trying to focus on studying!

title: Best focus app!
content: Best focus app! Uses game theory to keep you coming back for more and becoming better at focusing!

title: Great App but Very Glitchy
content: I love this app, and have been using it for years, but the deep focus mode is broken. Hopefully there is an update soon that fixes it!

title: App Stopped Working
content: Forest almost never gets updates or new features. It would be great if a break timer would start automatically when a focus session is completed and to have the ability to set different length breaks based on how many sessions have been completed. However, the usability of the app needs to be fixed ASAP. I can‚Äôt use the app now. It either crashes when I open it, opens but is frozen, or doesn‚Äôt start a session but still kills a tree. It is a little frustrating that the app all of a sudden stopped working and that I have to use coins to remove planting records that I didn‚Äôt even fail.

title: Great!
content: Perfect for focusing! Easy to use!

content: Haven‚Äôt used the app for long, but it has helped me focus.

If you try and allow your banking app as one to be used in focus mode the app shuts down. What‚Äôs the point? Useless.

It no longer tracks when I leave the app (writing this as my tree is growing in deep focus mode), and I can grow trees without staying in the app at all, which defeats the entire purpose of the app. I hope the devs fix this bug because this app was really useful to me before this!

content: It's amazing for keeping me off my phone, but do we seriously need micro transactions in a PAID app? It also takes away from the actual point of the app, which is to keep you focused, not get you sidetracked on some new tree skin. Would be 5 stars if not for this hypocritical behavior
